label: Description
value: Wall pocket with two pockets and a rounded top. Made from coral-colored silk taffeta, embroidered in gold and silver threads. The lower pocket has a house surrounded by flowering vines. The upper pocket shows a cardinal's hat with flowering vines. At the top, a bishop's mitre with a red stone inset, and crossed croziers. Trimmed with gold fringe and gold lace. Pockets lined with blue silk. Backed with leather.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: Embroidery on coral silk plain weave moire. Stem and satin stitches plus couching using gold and silver-wrapped silk; attached bobbin-lace of gold-wrapped silk.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Wall pocket in red satin, embroidered in polychrome silks and metal threads. Four pockets and a shaped top, each decorated with flowers, worked in satin stitch and shaded, and outlined with metal thread and with couched metal thread for foliage. Fruit, wheat, and birds also feature in the design. Edged with gold lace, bound with linen tape and backed with red brocatelle.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: embroidery on rust-red silk satin in stem, satin and knot stitches using dyed silks; couched gold-wrapped silk and strips of silver foil; plus, attached silver spangles

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Wall pocket with three pockets, in red silk velvet embroidered in gold and silver threads in heavy symmetrical floral designs. Pockets outlined with narrow silver lace, and whole edged with same.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Long wall pocket with four sections and shaped top, made to hang. Bright red satin with embroidery in colored silks and metal threads. Each section has a symmetrical vine and flower design worked in polychrome silks, with gold threads, cords, and raised work. Trimmed with gold braid; backed with red taffeta.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal thread Technique: satin weave with silk and metal thread embroidery

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Wall pocket with three pockets and highly ornamental shaped top. Two pockets of pale blue silk, one of faded rose, embroidered in symmetrical floral designs in silk and heavy gold thread and looped wire. At the top a small bird in an elaborate enframement. Bound with blue silk tape and lined with pale pink linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidery on salmon (faded) and blue silk plain weave; stem, knot, satin and chain stitches using dyed silks; couched gold-wrapped silk and strips of silver foil; plus attached coils of silver and gilt wire.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Wall pocket in yellow silk with embroidery in metal threads and applique of silk of human figures with painted faces.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: applique of painted silks and painted paper plus embroidery on brown silk satin; couched gold-wrapped silk and strips of gilt foil plus attached gilt spangles

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Wall pocket with three pockets of rose silk, decorated with metal trimming laid on in high relief in symmetrical designs. Trimmed with looped fringe.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Long shaped panel from the left side of a robe. Pale blue satin embroidered in colored silks with accents of brilliants and paper roses. Parts of the design are outlined using white feathers. Overall pattern is garlands gathering clusters of small flowers. Appliquéd border of white satin embroidered in an imbricated pattern with a diamond-shape drop in each scale.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, silk chenille, silk-wrapped corrugated strips of flat metal, silk-wrapped wire coils, feathers, brilliants, paper Technique: embroidery on 8-harness satin using satin, stem and couching stitches, 5-harness satin appliqué

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Long shaped panel from the left side of a robe. Pale blue satin embroidered in colored silks with accents of brilliants and paper roses. Parts of the design are outlined using white feathers. Overall pattern is garlands gathering clusters of small flowers. Appliquéd border of white satin embroidered in an imbricated pattern with a diamond-shape drop in each scale.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, silk chenille, silk-wrapped corrugated strips of flat metal, silk-wrapped wire coils, feathers, brilliants, paper Technique: embroidery on 8-harness satin using satin, stem and couching stitches, 5-harness satin appliqué

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Long, narrow shaped panel of white satin decorated with ribbon embroidery and silk thread. Designs of delicate festoons of flowers and ribbons extend almost entirely across the panel, primarily in narrow ribbons instead of silk thread. Some festoons of dots outlined in metallic thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered on satin weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Chalice veil of red silk taffeta embroidered in silver metallic yarns. In the center "I.H.S." is embroidered in a circular frame of wheat and grapes. In each corner, a spray of roses and carnations in gathered with a bowknot; connected by scrolling lines. Edged with narrow gold bobbin lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: metallic embroidery on silk foundation Technique: embroidered on plain weave, bobbin lace trimming Label: silk embroidered with metallic yarns, metallic bobbin lace edging

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Long, narrow shaped panel, probably from a skirt, that is narrower at the top and curved at the bottom. Cream-white twill weave with brocading in a small floral design. Embroidered in multicolored silks, metallic threads and paillettes. Narrow borders and festoons of flowers extend across the panel, each caught with a ribbon and tassels in metallic thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered on twill weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

value: Border of square compartments with a narrow serpentine band running through the entire length. Pieced edged by pendants.

value: Medium: linen Technique: grid of laid cords with needle lace, reticella style, edge of punto in aria

label: Description
value: Flat bag of white silk taffeta, embroidered on both sides with colored silks and metal threads; front, basket of flowers; back, flower spray with bird. Trimmed with narrow gold lace. Blue silk cord at top; covered tassels at corners.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metallic embroidery on silk foundation Technique: embroidered on plain weave foundation

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (without handles): 18.4 x 27.3 cm (7 1/4 x 10 3/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Three pieces of unbleached linen cloth decorated with weft looping and joined loosely on the long sides. Heavy pattern wefts looped on surface to form stylized animals and flowers in square framework. Left piece has inscriptions above and below large panel with vase and flowers: "Año de 1791. Soi (?) Antonio Garcia." Linen fringe on three sides.

label: Description
value: Interior of a sculptor's studio. Sculptor working on a large figure in the background. Man at right examines a small model.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache over traces of graphite on cream wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Molded with two swans swimming in rough water among fish and shells and flanked by bulrushes, a heron wading with a fish in its beak another in flight above, on a spiral shell-mounted ground. Decorated with a gilt rim and a large coat-of-armor at the top beneath border.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Provenance
value: Count Szembek; 1950: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Commander Henry H. Gorringe
The Moon, from The Seven Planets

label: Description
value: The figure of the Moon stands, facing the viewer. She holds a staff in her left hand; the crescent moon in her right hand. She is accompanied by Cancer (the crab). At upper left the word "LUNA" and the symbol for silver.

label: Description
value: The figure of Christ is shown standing on a cloud, holding the orb in his left hand, and giving the benediction with his right. Stigmata wounds visible at his feet.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leo Wallerstein

label: Description
value: The two apostles are shown walking toward the right, one carrying a large key at left (Saint Peter); the other a sword (Saint Paul). Indications of a wooden fence and a mountainous landscape in the background.

label: Description
value: Circular composition. Christ is seated at left, receiving a goblet presented by a man who stands with another man and a woman, to the right.
The Flagellation of Christ, from series The Passion of Christ

label: Description
value: Christ is at center being flagellated by men surrounding him. At left, a man kneels to retrieve a crown of thorns.
Christ Before Pilate, from series The Passion of Christ

label: Description
value: Christ is seen at right, wearing a crown of thorns, held by a group of soldiers. Pilate sits on his high chair, slightly to left of center, facing the viewer. He washes his hands in a basin held by his servant, at left. Two dogs in foreground.
Christ Carrying the Cross (Road to Calvary), from series The Passion of Christ

label: Description
value: Christ is shown in the center of the composition, carrying the cross. He moves toward the right, followed by a large crowd, and preceded by a man holding a rope attached to the waist of Christ.
Saint Philip and Saint James Major

label: Description
value: The figures of Apostles Philip and James are shown, walking toward the right. Saint Philip carrying a crozier or staff, surmounted by a cross; Saint James Major carrying a pilgrim's staff.
